fr.upmc.components.pre.plugins

Interface PluginI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlugin

    public interface PluginI
extends java.io.Serializable
    The interface PluginI defines the basic implementation services of component plug-ins seen as objects.

    Description

    This interface is implemented directly or indirectly by all objects implementing a plug-in. The default

    Created on : February 5, 2016

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getPluginURI()
      return the URI of this plug-in.
      void installOn(ComponentI owner)
      initialise the plug-in reference to its owner component and add to the component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in; subclasses should add any other initialisation necessary to make the plug-in work in the context of its owner.
      boolean isInitialised()
      return true if the plug-in is fully initialised and ready to execute in the context of its owner component.
      void uninstall()
      uninstall the plug-in from its owner component.

      • installOn

        void installOn(ComponentI owner)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        initialise the plug-in reference to its owner component and add to the component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in; subclasses should add any other initialisation necessary to make the plug-in work in the context of its owner.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        owner - component on which the plug-in is installed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
